p: Among the 16 ears of the 8 healthy subjects, 15 showed responses in the recordings obtained without occlusion, while all 16 ears exhibited responses in the recordings obtained with occlusion ( Figure 1). The N1-P1 amplitude was significantly larger in the recordings obtained with occlusion [mean ± SE (SD): 12.3 ± 1.67 (6.71) μV] than in those obtained without occlusion [9.55 ± 1.55 (6.21) μV] (mean difference: 2.75 μV, p = 0.020, paired t-test; Figure 2). The mean AR was 21.4 ± 5.52 (15.6) and 32.3 ± 11.6 (32.8) in the presence and absence of occlusion, respectively.
